$interpreted: Sailor: Dirty turtle, you gettin' onboard or what? If you're not getting on, snap out of it and stop screwing things up!
Jia-Shen: I'm not a turtle...
Jia-Shen: I'm a tortoise...
Jia-Shen: (Kicked out of school? It was so darn hard to become an exchange student...now I gotta go back with nothin' to show for it...)
Jia-Shen: (Everyone's gonna say I put a whole tin o' shame on the family name, might even throw me out...)
Jia-Shen: Gosh diddly goddamn!
Jia-Shen: (No way, with that many wolves I'm just askin' to be killed...)
Granny Xica: Ouch...don't ya'll eat my weary ol' body now...
Jia-Shen: Screw it! If the Lord'll have me, then the Lord'll have me!
Jia-Shen: Meemaw, ya'll right? Lemme heal you up nice and good!
Granny Xica: Thank you, child. Did you see my flowers?
Jia-Shen: Flowers?
Granny Xica: Thank you so much. You're such a good child...*cough*...*cough*...
Jia-Shen: Your body ain't no good now, ya here? Why you running off to a dangerous place like this?
Granny Xica: Hehe~I came to pick some flowers. And what about you? What brings you here?
Jia-Shen: I-I-I...
Granny Xica: Child, why don't you hold off on that. Will you walk with me somewhere?
Child: Granny Xica~we wanna hear a story!
Granny Xica: Alrighty bitey~~Once upon a time~
Granny Xica: The road to the desert was blocked by a wall of wind. To save the animals, the Snake God and Goddess...
Local: Really appreciate you saving Granny Xica. If anything happened to her, well these kids...
Jia-Shen: Don't...don't mention it...but, speaking of kids, why there are so many here?
Local: The adults are all busy working, so Granny Xica spends time playing with them.
Local: Granny's relatives were all lost in the border wars, so she sees the people here as family.
Jia-Shen: (Working so hard for others...I could never do something as noble as that...)
Granny Xica: And that's it for today. Brother Jia-Shen's got something for you all~
Child: Wah! Thanks so much brother turtle!
Jia-Shen: I'm a tortoise...and I didn't pick these flowers...
Granny Xica: Hehe, but you brought them here, didn't you? Plus, I really oughta thank you.
Child: Granny Xica, why is brother turtle so dirty? Is he homeless?
Jia-Shen: I...
Granny Xica: He's not homeless, he's family. Isn't that right, child?

Model.Text: Dirty turtle, you gettin' onboard or what? If you're not getting on, snap out of it and stop screwing things up!
I'm not a turtle...
I'm a tortoise...
(Kicked out of school? It was so darn hard to become an exchange student...now I gotta go back with nothin' to show for it...)
(Everyone's gonna say I put a whole tin o' shame on the family name, might even throw me out...)
Ahh!
Gosh diddly goddamn!
(No way, with that many wolves I'm just askin' to be killed...)
Ouch...don't ya'll eat my weary ol' body now...
Screw it! If the Lord'll have me, then the Lord'll have me!
Meemaw, ya'll right? Lemme heal you up nice and good!
Thank you, child. Did you see my flowers?
Flowers?
Thank you so much. You're such a good child...*cough*...*cough*...
Your body ain't no good now, ya here? Why you running off to a dangerous place like this?
Hehe~I came to pick some flowers. And what about you? What brings you here?
Child, why don't you hold off on that. Will you walk with me somewhere?
Granny Xica~we wanna hear a story!
Alrighty bitey~~Once upon a time~
The road to the desert was blocked by a wall of wind. To save the animals, the Snake God and Goddess...
Really appreciate you saving Granny Xica. If anything happened to her, well these kids...
Don't...don't mention it...but, speaking of kids, why there are so many here?
The adults are all busy working, so Granny Xica spends time playing with them.
Granny's relatives were all lost in the border wars, so she sees the people here as family.
(Working so hard for others...I could never do something as noble as that...)
And that's it for today. Brother Jia-Shen's got something for you all~
Wah! Thanks so much brother turtle!
I'm a tortoise...and I didn't pick these flowers...
Hehe, but you brought them here, didn't you? Plus, I really oughta thank you.
Granny Xica, why is brother turtle so dirty? Is he homeless?
He's not homeless, he's family. Isn't that right, child?
